democode package

Submodules

democode.audio_main module

democode.audio_main.main()[source]

Main function to convert a PDF file into an audiobook using command line arguments.

This function uses argparse to parse command line arguments for the input PDF file, the voice to be used for text-to-speech conversion, and the start and end pages for the conversion. It then calls the create_audio function to perform the conversion.

Parameters:

arguments. (None. The function retrieves all necessary information from command line) –

Returns:

None. The function calls create_audio which writes the resulting audio to an MP3 file.

Raises:

argparse.ArgumentError – If the command line arguments are not correctly provided.

democode.helper module

democode.helper.create_audio(pdf_file, voice, page_range)[source]

Creates an audio file from a given PDF file using text-to-speech conversion.

This function reads the text from the specified pages of a PDF file, converts the text to speech using the specified voice, and saves the resulting audio to an MP3 file. The name of the output file is the same as the input file, but with the extension changed to .mp3.

Parameters:

  • pdf_file (str) – The path to the PDF file to be converted to audio.

  • voice (str) – The voice to be used for the text-to-speech conversion.

  • page_range (list) – A list of page numbers to be included in the audio. Page numbers start from 0.

Returns:

None. The function writes the resulting audio to an MP3 file.

democode.helper.day_to_column(day)[source]

Converts a given day number to a corresponding column letter(s) in a spreadsheet.

This function takes a day number and converts it to a corresponding column letter(s) in a spreadsheet. The conversion is based on the ASCII values of the English alphabet letters. The function uses a while loop to iterate through the day number and generate the corresponding column letter(s).

Parameters:

day (int) – The day number to be converted to a column letter(s).

Returns:

The corresponding column letter(s) for the given day number.

Return type:

str

democode.helper.tts_text(text, voice)[source]

Converts a given text into speech using Google’s Text-to-Speech API.

This function takes a text string and a voice name as input, synthesizes the text into speech using the specified voice, and returns the synthesized speech as an audio file in MP3 format.

Parameters:

  • text (str) – The text to be converted into speech.

  • voice (str) – The name of the voice to be used for the speech synthesis. This should be a valid voice name supported by Google’s Text-to-Speech API.

Returns:

The response from the Text-to-Speech API, which includes the synthesized speech audio.

Return type:

google.cloud.texttospeech_v1.types.SynthesizeSpeechResponse

democode.spreadsheet_main module

democode.spreadsheet_main.get_cell()[source]

Generates a cell reference in a Google Sheets spreadsheet for the current date.

This function generates a cell reference in a Google Sheets spreadsheet for the current date. The cell reference is in the format ‘YearMonth!Column38’, where Year is the current year, Month is the current month in full text (e.g., January, February, etc.), Column is the corresponding column letter(s) for the current day number, and 38 is a fixed row number. The function uses the datetime module to get the current date and the day_to_column function to convert the day number to a column letter(s).

Returns:

The cell reference in the format ‘YearMonth!Column38’ for the current date.

Return type:

str
